name: Ace of Wands
description: A hand emerges from a cloud holding a blossoming wand — the spark of creation and vitality taking form.

name: Two of Wands
description: A figure stands between two wands, gazing out over the land — vision, dominion, and the anticipation of progress.

name: Three of Wands
description: A merchant watches ships sail across the sea — expansion, foresight, and reward for enterprise.

name: Four of Wands
description: Garlanded wands form a joyful gateway — festivity, homecoming, and stability built on success.

name: Five of Wands
description: Five youths clash with wands in mock battle — competition, tension, and the struggle of equals.

name: Six of Wands
description: A laureled horseman receives acclaim — triumph, recognition, and victory after struggle.

name: Seven of Wands
description: A lone figure defends a hilltop with a wand — perseverance, courage, and defiance against odds.

name: Eight of Wands
description: Eight wands fly swiftly through the air — movement, rapid progress, and the approach of change.

name: Nine of Wands
description: A weary warrior leans on his wand, wounded but vigilant — resilience, discipline, and faith in adversity.

name: Ten of Wands
description: A man bears ten wands heavily toward a town — the weight of duty, ambition, and overburdened success.

name: Page of Wands
description: A youthful messenger holds a staff upright, eager to announce new ventures or passions.

name: Knight of Wands
description: A fiery knight charges forward on horseback — energy, impulsiveness, and the pursuit of challenge.

name: Queen of Wands
description: A regal woman sits with her wand and sunflower — warmth, charisma, and strength in independence.

name: King of Wands
description: A king upon his throne holds a flowering wand — leadership, vision, and authority tempered by creativity.

name: Ace of Wands Reversed
description: The hand drops the wand, its leaves withering — blocked inspiration or delayed beginnings.

name: Two of Wands Reversed
description: The figure looks back uncertainly, ambition faltering — fear of change or loss of initiative.

name: Three of Wands Reversed
description: Ships drift aimlessly on calm waters — delay, miscommunication, or plans falling short.

name: Four of Wands Reversed
description: The festive garlands droop — instability in the home or fleeting happiness.

name: Five of Wands Reversed
description: The mock battle turns bitter — needless quarrels and petty conflict.

name: Six of Wands Reversed
description: The rider falters, losing acclaim — delayed recognition or pride before a fall.

name: Seven of Wands Reversed
description: The defender drops his staff — giving in to pressure or hesitation in battle.

name: Eight of Wands Reversed
description: The wands lose flight and fall to the ground — stagnation or missed messages.

name: Nine of Wands Reversed
description: The wounded man lowers his guard — exhaustion, distrust, or loss of faith.

name: Ten of Wands Reversed
description: The burden slips from the man’s arms — collapse under pressure or release through surrender.

name: Page of Wands Reversed
description: The messenger falters, his message lost — instability, indecision, or broken communication.

name: Knight of Wands Reversed
description: The fiery knight’s passion burns too hot — impulsiveness, rash action, or disruption.

name: Queen of Wands Reversed
description: The sunflower wilts in her grasp — jealousy, deceit, or misuse of influence.

name: King of Wands Reversed
description: The king’s wand droops, his vision clouded — arrogance, intolerance, or reckless power.
